column4: My networking is down. It worked fine last time I used it but now I cant connect. (I'm connected to another router now, but the router is fine.)
Anyone know how I can get the log of what's failing when I try to connect to my router?
Can anyone tell me where I can find the log of my wired connection? It fails to connect to my router.
now its time to make it faster and get rid of everything you dont need... that should take some of your time.
My ubuntu install often crashes... (more often than XP did unfortunately)
as an example, an hour ago, I left my PC unattended for about 30 mins, the screen saver went on (blank screen), I could never recover, had to shutdown.
Firefox-bin and Xorg take up to 50% CPU on flash sites.
Synergy crashes when using hotkeys to switch screen (synergy is a software KM switch)
are yo sure it's the screensaver that crashes your comp and not  suspend ?
and it is normal for flash site to load your cpu I get the same
www.nhl.com loads my cpu at 50% under linux, and about 3% in windows.
that site gets my cpu up as well
